node.text:
Last chance to visit #theIlluminatingGas by #CerithWynEvans, on view at #PirelliHangarBicocca until Sunday 23 February. Get a copy of the brand new catalogue of the show at our bookshop! Swipe right to see the cover! 
Free Admission #ArtToThePeople 
Ph: Agostino Osio

3/3 
Last but not least an important presence in Trisha Baga’s practice is her dog Monkey. An intimate character of the artist’s daily life that accompanies her narrations and reflections, showing how personal and intimate moments become integral part of the work, captured as self-revealing and performative elements of her works.

#PirelliHangarBicocca presente the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli, on view until 19 July 2020. #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople

2/3

#PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli, on view until 19 July 2020. #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople

3/3 
Emblematic element in history of civilization is represented by the figure of the #horse, from first motifs in #cavepaintings and as the subject of the studies of movement in the photography of #EadweardMuybridge (1830–1904). In recent years a short video of a horse was inserted in the #DNA of a bacterium during a scientific experiment with the aim to test the possibility of using living cells to store information. According to Trisha Baga the body may be thought of “as a sort of living memory card” where organic and electronic entities are merged, opening a reflection on pivotal themes present in her practice: the technological cycles of evolution and obsolescence and technology most fragile and failing aspects.

#PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli, on view until 19 July 2020. #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople

3/3

In Trisha Baga’s videos literature references play a key role in pointing out topical issues inside the artist’s narratives, several extracts in particular from contemporary American literature are added in her works through writings on the screen or spoken words. In “Mollusca & The Pelvic Floor” (2018) the artist uses excerpts from “Imago” by #OctaviaButler (1947–2006), a Sci-fi novel investigating an alien species merging with humans, to reflect on interspecies connection, or in “There’s No “I” in Trisha” from #MaryShelley’s #Frankenstein, the first Sci-fi novel. Furthermore, for example, in “Madonna y El Niño” the closing scenes include a female voice reading extracts from the novel Beloved by #ToniMorrison (1931–2019)—the first African-American woman to win the Nobel prize.
Today at 7pm #PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli. Don’t miss the event! #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople

3/3

Sitcoms like #Friends or drama series like #GreysAnatomy gained worldwide success in the late ‘90s and 2000s. These #TVseries are based on stereotyped characters and situations that through the seasons entertain viewers with light comedy and happy ending stories accompanied by canned laughter and catchy jingles or tragic and cliffhanger events. In her first work “There is no “I” in Trisha” (2005-2007/2020) Trisha Baga conceived a #sitcom where all the roles are played by the artist herself, parodying typecast situations and questioning the gender stereotypes and how they are portrayed in the media. 
Tomorrow at 7 PM the exhibition “the eye the eye the ear” by #TrishaBaga and curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli opens at #PirelliHangarBicocca. Don’t miss the event! Free Admission #ArtToThePeople

2/3

3/3 
Sci-fi films often reflect on the evolution of technology and its use in looking for new forms of life through time and universe and in finding a way to communicate with them. In 1997 film #Contact #JodieFoster stars as Dr. Ellie Arroway, a scientist hoping to find evidence of alien life. A clip of the film, featuring a zoom out of the camera from the Earth, is included in Trisha Baga’s video “Mollusca & The Pelvic Floor” (2018), part of the homonymous multifaceted installation. The artist creates a multilayered narration where she deals with the interspecies connection between different living organisms, ironically showed through the relationship between Baga and Mollusca, the homophonic pseudonym the artist has given to the household Al unit developed by #Amazon, #Alexa.

This Wednesday at 7pm #PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli. Don’t miss the event! #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople

‪3/3
Pop iconic figures such as #RuPaul, the #dragqueen diva, model and TV presenter, are often portrayed by Trisha Baga in her ceramics sculpture, a way for the artist to “fossilize” and embody a hypothetical primordial rendering of the reality that surrounds us and its popular imagery. Coming from the #LGBTQI+ scene of Atlanta, Georgia, RuPaul became widely known for her song #Supermodel of the World in 1993 and today she is considered the most commercially successful drag queen in the United States with her talent show “RuPaul’s #DragRace” and its several spin-offs.‬ ‪Wednesday 19 February 2020 at 7pm #PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli. Don’t miss the event! #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople‬

‪2/3

Coming from the #LGBTQI+ scene of Atlanta, Georgia, RuPaul became widely known for her song #Supermodel of the World in 1993 and today she is considered the most commercially successful drag queen in the United States with her talent show @rupaulsdragrace and its several spin-offs.‬ ‪Wednesday 19 February 2020 at 7pm #PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli. Don’t miss the event! #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople‬ #DragRace

‪3/3
Body transformation and #genderidentity have a key presence in Trisha Baga’s work and through her ironic point of view she questions typecast gender roles and sexuality and the social norms that regulate them. In her 1928 novel “Orlando. A Biography” #VirginiaWoolf portrays #Orlando and his/her sexual transformation through the centuries, a character that overcomes stereotypes. In 1992 director #SallyPotter realized a film based on the novel starring #TildaSwinton as Orlando.‬ ‪Trisha Baga takes the title of her installation “ORLANDO” (2015-2020) from the Woolf’s book. The work presents a large writing on a wall, an excerpt from the foreword of the book Half Mile Down (1934) written by the naturalist and scientist William Beebe, featuring  a disclaimer of possible printing imperfections of the volume. However, Baga has replaced the word “book” with the word “man”, thereby generating a paradoxical swap of identities between man and object.‬
‪Wednesday 19 February 2020 at 7pm #PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli. Don’t miss the event! #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople‬

3/3

Through her career popstar @madonna spanned from several transformations of her character and aspect: from the witty bride in her song #LikeaVirgin video clip in 1984 to the iconic #TrueBlue video in 1986, from portraying Evita Peron in the acclaimed film #Evita in 1996 to the queen of the dancefloor for her 2005 album “Confessions on a Dancefloor”, and finally to the last years evolution in #MadameX.

In 2010 Trisha Baga conceived the video installation “Madonna y El Niño”, introducing her fascination for her figure and for natural phenomena, comparing the evolution of #Madonna’s mediated self-image to the climate phenomenon #ElNiño linked to periodic warming across the central and east-central Equatorial Pacific Ocean. Rapid and fluid sequences intertwine footage of Madonna’s 2006 Confessions concert tour and readings of the popstar’s journal entries with Baga performing as reflection, audience, metaphor, stand in, editor, and eventually, projection screen.

Wednesday 19 February 2020 at 7pm #PirelliHangarBicocca presents the solo show by Trisha Baga, “the eye, the eye and the hear”, curated by #LuciaAspesi and #FiammettaGriccioli. Don’t miss the event! #TrishaBaga #ArtToThePeople

2/3
